hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Vacuum Reversal After Stress-Event
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a sharp, catalyst-driven sell-off (>8% in <6 hours) that pushes the market into a STRESS regime, the first 2-hour period where the 5-minute realized volatility drops below 50% of its peak during the sell-off will precede a strong, but short-lived, technical rebound of 3-6% as exhausted sellers pause and opportunistic liquidity provision enters.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Violent, catalyst-driven sell-offs exhaust immediate selling pressure and create a liquidity vacuum. The drop in short-term volatility signals a pause in panic. This attracts short-term mean reversion traders, high-frequency liquidity providers, and profit-taking from shorts, creating a predictable but fragile rebound. The catalyst creates the oversold condition and the volatility signal provides the timing edge.
entry_conditions: Market transitions to STRESS regime (per FjordHQ model) following a clear catalyst
BTC experiences a >8% drop from local high within a 6-hour window
The 5-minute realized volatility (20-period) peaks above 150% annualized, then falls to below 75% annualized (a >50% drop from peak)
Entry on the close of the first 2-hour candle where the low-volatility condition is met

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new low below the stress-event low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If, after a stress-event sell-off, periods of collapsing short-term volatility consistently lead to further downside continuation or sideways chop instead of a technical rebound.
